LPT NHS workers and volunteers celebrated for long service at special ceremony

<div class="col-md-4 col-sm-4 col-xs-12 | eq-height--item"><!-- 43554@ --><!-- https://www.leicspart.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/Flu-heroes-logo.png@ --><!-- https://www.leicspart.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/Flu-heroes-logo-360x214.png@ --><div class="card-item card-post">
Thousands of school children and young people offered protection against flu

<div class="col-md-4 col-sm-4 col-xs-12 | eq-height--item"><!-- 43109@ --><!-- https://www.leicspart.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Stock-news-winner.png@ --><!-- https://www.leicspart.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Stock-news-winner-360x214.png@ --><div class="card-item card-post">
LPT recruitment drive for student health visitors and school nurses up for top healthcare award
"I love working for the local population - I'm passionate about helping the people of Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland."
John Barnes, Charge Nurse, LD Short Breaks
"I really enjoy the human interaction on a daily basis - with colleagues, patients, relatives. Good communication skills are key."
"I progressed from being an apprentice to a Corporate Affairs Administrator - the NHS really supports staff development."
"I like that I'm able to help both staff and service users. It's really rewarding."
"I have developed so many new skills over the years working in the NHS, going from a healthcare assistant to a nursing associate."
Daxa Mangia, Mental Health Nurse, The Willows
"I really enjoy my job, helping people to recover - I cannot imagine doing anything else."
We're always looking for the best. Make a difference with a career at LPT.
• › Our Values
• › Valued Star Awards
We have four core values: Compassion, Respect, Integrity, Trust.
This monthly award is about recognising members of staff who have gone the extra mile.
